properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:14 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-29T02:13:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T23:14:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3844391641.2020
Area: Témiscouata
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazards: - hail near 2 cm in size - heavy rain near 50 mm in one hour - wind gusts near 90 km/h This severe thunderstorm is located from Clarence to Beauchampville, moving south at 20 km/h. Locations impacted include: Rockland, Clarence, Becketts Creek, Vinette, Clarence-Rockland, Rockland East, Clarence Creek, Orient and St-Pascal. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Locally heavy rain is also possible. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Summary:

Locally heavy rain is also possible. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain until this evening. Boaters may be caught off guard by strong gusts on smaller bodies of water. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-29T04:09:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T22:48:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1387384778.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:13 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. There is a thunderstorm over Crane River moving north northeast at 30 km/h. There is additionally a thunderstorm just northwest of Glenella that is also traveling north-northeast at 30 km/h. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-29T00:00:45-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and torrential rain. A stationary front is triggering scattered thunderstorms over western Manitoba this evening. Some of these thunderstorms may reach severe limits. Thunderstorms are expected to redevelop across much of the watch area later this afternoon and will persist well into the night. This severe thunderstorm watch may be expanded eastwards this afternoon as the event unfolds. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-29T06:57:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T22:59:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1487404387.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts and heavy rain. A line of thunderstorm approaching from the west are slowly moving into Edmundston County as of 6:00 pm ADT. The main threat is for heavy rainfall amounts and possibly strong and gusty winds. The line will continue to move into northwest New Brunswick, but impacts should diminish this evening. ### Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-29T01:29:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T21:31:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1502587552.2020
Area: Edmundston and Madawaska County, western half of Restigouche County, Grand Falls and Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:49 p.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A line of thunderstorms has formed from Pipestone, MB southwest to Gainsborough, SK. Thunderstorms on the line are moving north at 30 km/h. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-29T01:32:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T22:50:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2654239929.2020
Area: R.M. of Argyle including Gainsborough and Carievale
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 38 are expected. A prolonged period of hot weather continues over portions of southern and east-central Manitoba. Southerly winds are spreading hot and humid weather into Manitoba. Over the coming days, daytime highs will climb into the low thirties with overnight lows staying in the upper teens or low twenties. Humidex values will be in the upper thirties/low forties. The heat will begin to break through the latter half of the week. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. For more information on heat and your health: - Visit Manitoba Health at: http://www.manitoba.ca/health/publichealth/environmentalhealth/heat.html. - Call Health Links – Info Santé at 204-788-8200 or toll-free at 1-888-315-9257. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-29T13:51:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T21:52:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4114189614.2020
Area: Oxford House and Gods Lake, Red Sucker Lake, Island Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:09 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. This thunderstorm just east of McCreary that is traveling north-northeast at 30 km/h. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:20 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. A large thunderstorm is near Shamattawa and is moving northeast at 50 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-29T02:14:00-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:12 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts and up to toonie size hail. Hazards: - hail of 2-3 cm in size - heavy rain of 50 mm in one hour - wind gusts near 90 km/h This severe thunderstorm is located near Barrhaven, moving southwest at 30 km/h. Locations impacted include: Richmond, Munster, Goodstown, Malakoff, Barrhaven, Carsonby, Manotick, Mansfield, Stapledon, Fallowfield, Région de la Capitale nationale, Twin Elm, Mills Corners, Baxters Corners, Moores Corners, Pierces Corners, Merivale Station, Watterson Corners and Gloucester Glen. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:18 p.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking an area of severe thunderstorms capable of producing torrential rain. A line of thunderstorms has formed from Virden, MB southwest to Carnduff, SK. Thunderstorms continue to redevelop over the same area and heavy rain is expected. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-29T02:09:35-00:00
